Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] tammat al-kitāb Khusraw va Shīrīn bi-'awn Malik [sic] /1/ al-Wahhāb bi-tārīkh ghurrah-'i Safar sanat-i /2/ 885 /3/ m (= tamma) /4/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.604 contains 1 of 4 short colophons in Arabic at the end of Makhzan al-asrar (dated Ramadan 885), Khusraw va Shirin (dated 1st Safar 885), Laylá va Majnun (dated 5 Rabi' I 886), and Haft paykar (dated 22 Ramadan 885). The name of the scribe is not recorded.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Timurid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; New Abbasid Style; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Nizami Ganjavi (Azerbaijani, died 605 AH/AD 1209)
